title: By the Queene. Whereas the Queenes most excellent Maiestie by her hyghnesse proclamation, geuen at her manour of Hauering the xiii. of Iuly last for diuers considerations in the same expressed, was pleased to shorten the day before limited for the reading of the lottery ...
author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)
publisher: In Powles Churchyard by Richard Iugge, and Iohn Cawood, Printers to the Queenes Maiestie [i.e. B. Norton and J. Bill],
notes: A proclamation postponing the drawing date of the great lottery.
Actual printers' names and suggested publication date from STC.
At foot of sheet: Cum priuilegio Regi√¶ Maiestatis.
Last indented line to the right of initial begins: "for".
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
